MaplyMapnikVectorTiles Class Reference

Inherits from NSObject
Conforms to MaplyPagingDelegate
Declared in MaplyMapnikVectorTiles.h

Overview

Create one of these to read Mapnik PBF style tiles from a remote or local source. This handles the geometry creation, calls a delegate for the styling and can read from remote or local data files.

  tileSources

One or more tile sources to fetch data from per tile

@property (nonatomic, readonly) NSArray *tileSources

Declared In

Declared In

MaplyMapnikVectorTiles.h

+ StartRemoteVectorTilesWithTileSpec:accessToken:style:styleType:cacheDir:viewC:success:failure:

A convenience method that fetches all the relevant files and creates a vector tiles object.

+ (void)StartRemoteVectorTilesWithTileSpec:(NSString *)tileSpec accessToken:(NSString *)accessToken style:(NSString *)styleFile styleType:(MapnikStyleType)styleType cacheDir:(NSString *)cacheDir viewC:(MaplyBaseViewController *)viewC success:(void ( ^ ) ( MaplyMapnikVectorTiles *vecTiles ))successBlock failure:(void ( ^ ) ( NSError *error ))failureBlock

Parameters

tileSpec

Either a local filename or a URL to the remote JSON tile spec.
accessToken

The access key provided by your service.
styleFile

Either a local file name or a URL for the Mapnik XML style file.
cacheDir

Where to cache the vector tiles, or nil for no caching.
viewC

View controller the data will be associated with.
successBlock

This block is called with the vector tiles object on success. You’ll need to create the paging layer and attach the vector tiles to it.
failureBlock

This block is called if any of the loading fails.

Discussion

This method will fetch all the relevant config files necessary to start a Mapnik vector tile object and the call you back to set up the actual layer.

Declared In

MaplyMapnikVectorTiles.h

+ StartRemoteVectorTilesWithURL:ext:minZoom:maxZoom:accessToken:style:styleType:cacheDir:viewC:success:failure:

A convenience method that fetches all the relevant files and creates a vector tiles object.

+ (void)StartRemoteVectorTilesWithURL:(NSString *)tileURL ext:(NSString *)ext minZoom:(int)minZoom maxZoom:(int)maxZoom accessToken:(NSString *)accessToken style:(NSString *)styleFile styleType:(MapnikStyleType)styleType cacheDir:(NSString *)cacheDir viewC:(MaplyBaseViewController *)viewC success:(void ( ^ ) ( MaplyMapnikVectorTiles *vecTiles ))successBlock failure:(void ( ^ ) ( NSError *error ))failureBlock

Parameters

tileURL

The URL to fetch vector tiles from.
ext

The tile extension to use.
minZoom

The minimum zoom level to use.
maxZoom

The maximum zoom level to use
accessToken

The access key provided by your service.
styleFile

Either a local file name or a URL for the Mapnik XML style file.
cacheDir

Where to cache the vector tiles, or nil for no caching.
viewC

View controller the data will be associated with.
successBlock

This block is called with the vector tiles object on success. You’ll need to create the paging layer and attach the vector tiles to it.
failureBlock

This block is called if any of the loading fails.

Discussion

This method will fetch all the relevant config files necessary to start a Mapnik vector tile object and the call you back to set up the actual layer.

MaplyMapnikVectorTiles.h

– initWithTileSources:style:viewC:

Init with a list of tile sources.

- (instancetype)initWithTileSources:(NSArray *)tileSources style:(NSObject<MaplyVectorStyleDelegate> *)style viewC:(MaplyBaseViewController *)viewC

Discussion

These are MaplyRemoteTileInfo objects and will be combined by the MaplyMapnikVectorTiles object for display.

Declared In

MaplyMapnikVectorTiles.h

– initWithMBTiles:style:viewC:

Init with the filename of an MBTiles archive containing PBF tiles.

- (instancetype)initWithMBTiles:(MaplyMBTileSource *)tileSource style:(NSObject<MaplyVectorStyleDelegate> *)style viewC:(MaplyBaseViewController *)viewC

Discussion

This will read individual tiles from an MBTiles archive containging PBF.

The file should be local.
